info.description:
Copyright 2018 - 2022 Trend Micro Incorporated.
Get protected, stay secured, and keep informed with Trend Micro Workload Security's new RESTful API. Access system data and manage security configurations to automate your security workflows and integrate Workload Security into your CI/CD pipeline. # Authentication
info.title: Trend Micro Workload Security API

Java

JavaScript

parameters.name: api-version
parameters.description: The version of the api being called.

x-codeSamples.source:
from __future__ import print_function
import sys, warnings
import deepsecurity
from deepsecurity.rest import ApiException
from pprint import pprint

# Setup
if not sys.warnoptions:
	warnings.simplefilter("ignore")
configuration = deepsecurity.Configuration()
configuration.host = 'YOUR_HOST'

# Authentication
configuration.api_key['api-secret-key'] = 'YOUR_API_KEY'
configuration.api_key['Authorization'] = 'YOUR_API_KEY'

# Initialization
# Set Any Required Values
api_instance = deepsecurity.AccountDetailsApi(deepsecurity.ApiClient(configuration))
api_version = 'YOUR VERSION'

try:
	api_response = api_instance.describe_current_account_details(api_version)
	pprint(api_response)
except ApiException as e:
	print("An exception occurred when calling AccountDetailsApi.describe_current_account_details: %s\n" % e)

from deepsecurity.rest import ApiException
from pprint import pprint

# Setup
if not sys.warnoptions:
	warnings.simplefilter("ignore")
configuration = deepsecurity.Configuration()
configuration.host = 'YOUR_HOST'

# Authentication
configuration.api_key['api-secret-key'] = 'YOUR_API_KEY'
configuration.api_key['Authorization'] = 'YOUR_API_KEY'

# Initialization
# Set Any Required Values
api_instance = deepsecurity.SystemSettingsApi(deepsecurity.ApiClient(configuration))
name = 'name_example'
api_version = 'YOUR VERSION'

try:
	api_response = api_instance.describe_system_setting(name, api_version)
	pprint(api_response)
except ApiException as e:
	print("An exception occurred when calling SystemSettingsApi.describe_system_setting: %s\n" % e)

Trend_Micro_Cloud_One_API_Key.description:
Authenticate with a Trend Micro Cloud One API key.

For information on creating and using a Trend Micro Cloud One API key, see the [API key help](https://cloudone.trendmicro.com/docs/account-and-user-management/c1-api-key/).

```http
Authorization: ApiKey {apiKey}
```
Trend_Micro_Cloud_One_API_Key.name: Authorization

Legacy_API_Key.description:
**DEPRECATED**

Authenticate with an API key from a Legacy Trend Micro Cloud One account.

For information on legacy accounts, see the [Accounts help](https://cloudone.trendmicro.com/docs/account-and-user-management/c1-accounts-about/).

For information on creating and using a legacy API key, see the Workload Security [API key help](https://cloudone.trendmicro.com/docs/workload-security/api-keys/).

```http
api-secret-key: {apiSecretKey}
```
Legacy_API_Key.name: api-secret-key

licenseMode.description: License mode of the current Cloud One Account.

cloudOneAccountID.description: Account ID of the current Cloud One Account.

cloudOneAccountName.description: Account Name of the current Cloud One Account.

cloudOneBillingState.description: CloudOneBilling license state. Valid values are 'licensed' and 'unlicensed'

customerAccountID.description: customer Account ID of the tenant.

username.description: Username of the Administrator. Searchable as String. Not modifiable by Trend Micro Cloud One users.

password.description: Password of the Administrator. Not modifiable by Trend Micro Cloud One users.

fullName.description: Full name of the Administrator. Searchable as String. Not modifiable by Trend Micro Cloud One users.

description.description: Description of the Administrator. Searchable as String. Not modifiable by Trend Micro Cloud One users.

roleID.description: ID of the role assigned to the Administrator. Searchable as Numeric. Not modifiable by Trend Micro Cloud One users.

locale.description: Locale of the Administrator. Not modifiable by Trend Micro Cloud One users.

timeZone.description: Time zone of the Administrator. Searchable as String. Not modifiable by Trend Micro Cloud One users.

timeFormat.description: Time format preference of the Administrator. Can be either the 12-hour format or the 24-hour format. Searchable as Choice. Not modifiable by Trend Micro Cloud One users.

passwordNeverExpires.description: Enabled if the Administrator's password never expires. Defaults to `false`. Searchable as Boolean. Not modifiable by Trend Micro Cloud One users.

active.description: If set to `true`, the Administrator can authenticate. If set to `false`, the Administrator is locked out. Searchable as Boolean. Not modifiable by Trend Micro Cloud One users.

mfaType.description: Specifies the type of multi-factor authentication used to authenticate the Administrator. Defaults to `none`. Searchable as Choice. Not modifiable by Trend Micro Cloud One users.

phoneNumber.description: Phone number of the Administrator. Searchable as String.

mobileNumber.description: Mobile number of the Administrator. Searchable as String.

pagerNumber.description: Pager number of the Administrator. Searchable as String.

emailAddress.description: Email address of the Administrator. Searchable as String.

primaryContact.description: If set to `true`, the administrator is a primary contact. Primary contacts receive Deep Security as a Service account-related emails for that tenant. A valid `emailAddress` is required. Searchable as Boolean.

receiveNotifications.description: If set to `true`, alert emails will be sent to the Administrator. A valid `emailAddress` is required. Searchable as Boolean.

reportPDFPasswordEnabled.description: Controls whether the reports that the Administrator generates are password-protected. Set to `true` to password-protect, and `false` otherwise. Defaults to `false`. Searchable as Boolean.

reportPDFPassword.description: Password that protects the reports that the Administrator generates. Ignored when `reportPDFPasswordEnabled` is `false`.

created.description: Timestamp when the Administrator was created, in milliseconds since epoch. Searchable as Date.

lastPasswordChange.description: Timestamp when the Administrator's password was last changed, in milliseconds since epoch. Searchable as Date.

lastSignIn.description: Timestamp when the Administrator last signed in, in milliseconds since epoch. Searchable as Date.

unlockTime.description: Timestamp at which the Administrator will be unlocked, in milliseconds since epoch. Ignored if the Administrator is not locked out using a time-based lock out scheme. Searchable as Date.

unsuccessfulSignInAttempts.description: Number of unsuccessful sign-in attempts for the Administrator. This number is reset to `0` when a successful authentication occurs. Searchable as Numeric.

directoryName.description: Security Account Manager (SAM) account name for the Administrator. Ignored if the Administrator is not managed by an identity provider. Searchable as String.

directoryInfo.description: Unique ID used for single sign-on using a Security Account Manager (SAM) identity provider. Ignored if the Administrator is not managed by an identity provider.

external.description: If set to `true` the Administrator is externally authenticated using SAML. Defaults to `false`. Ignored if the Administrator is not externally authenticated. Searchable as Boolean.

externalUserID.description: SAML User ID of the Administrator. Used to support external authentication of the Administrator. Ignored if the Administrator is not externally authenticated. Searchable as String.

type.description: Administrator account type. Can either be `normal` or `temporary`. Defaults to `normal`. Searchable as Choice.

readOnly.description: Set to `true` if the Administrator is read-only. Defaults to `false`. Searchable as Boolean.

ID.description: ID of the Administrator. Searchable as ID.

administrator.description: Administrator details. An Administrator object represents a Deep Security user.

fieldName.description: Name of the field to be tested. Required for all tests except idTest.

booleanTest.description: Boolean test, suitable for boolean fields. Default "true".

numericTest.description: Numeric test, suitable for numeric fields, used in conjuction with the numericValue. Default "equal".

numericValue.description: Value used by the numericTest. Required when performing a numericTest.

numericValueList.description: Value list used by the numericTest. Required when performing a numericTest with IN/NOT-IN operator.

stringTest.description: String test, suitable for string fields, used in conjuction with the stringValue and stringWildcards. Default "equal".

stringValue.description: Value used by the stringTest. Required when performing a stringTest.

stringWildcards.description: Controls whether or not wildcard characters (`%` and `_`) are treated as wildcards (true) or regular characters (false). Default "true".

choiceTest.description: Choice test, suitable for enum fields, used in conjuction with the choiceValue. Default "equal".

choiceValue.description: Value used by the choiceTest. Required when performing a choiceTest.

firstDateValue.description: First (low) date used to find objects within a date range.  Null (the default) implies no lower limit on the date range.

firstDateInclusive.description: Indicates whether the results should include (true) or exclude (false) an exact match for the firstDateValue. Default "true".

lastDateValue.description: Last (high) date used to find objects within a date range.  Null (the default) implies no upper limit on the date range.

lastDateInclusive.description: Indicates whether the results should include (true) or exclude (false) an exact match for the lastDateValue. Default "true".

nullTest.description: Null test, suitable for finding fields containing a null value.

versionTest.description: Version test, suitable for version fields, used in conjuction with the versionValue. Default "equal".

versionValue.description: Value used by the versionTest. Required when performing a versionTest.

searchCriteria.description: Defines search criteria for use within a SearchFilter. Identifies the field of an object to test, the value to test against, and the type of test to perform, such as \"equal"\ or \"greater-than"\.

maxItems.description: Limits the number of objects returned. Default 5000.

searchCriteria.description: Array of search critiera used to filter objects. Searching with multiple criteria returns results that satisfy all of the criteria. Searching with no criteria returns all objects.

sortByObjectID.description: If true, forces the response objects to be sorted by ID, overriding the default sort order. Default "false".

searchFilter.description: Allows clients to obtain a filtered list of objects based on various search criteria.

name.description: Name of the anti-malware configuration. Searchable as String.

description.description: Description of the anti-malware configuration. Searchable as String.

scanType.description: The type of malware scan configuration. Searchable as Choice.

documentExploitProtectionEnabled.description: Controls whether to scan for known critical vulnerabilities. Use true to enable scan.

documentExploitProtection.description: Scan for exploits against known critical vulnerabilities only. Searchable as Choice.

documentExploitHeuristicLevel.description: Controls whether to scan for exploits of known critical vulnerabilites as well as aggessively detect suspicious behaviour that could be an unknown exploit. Searchable as Choice.

machineLearningEnabled.description: Controls whether predictive machine learning is enabled.  Set to true to enable. Searchable as Boolean.

behaviorMonitoringEnabled.description: Controls whether to detect suspicious activity and unauthorized changes (including ransomware). Set to true to detect.

documentRecoveryEnabled.description: Controls whether to back up ransomware-encrypted files. Set to true to back up. Searchable as Boolean.

intelliTrapEnabled.description: Controls whether IntelliTrap is enabled. Set to true to enable. Searchable as Boolean.

memoryScanEnabled.description: Controls whether to scan process memory for malware. Use true to enable scan. Searchable as Boolean.

spywareEnabled.description: Controls whether to enable spyware/grayware protection. Set to true to enable. Searchable as Boolean.

alertEnabled.description: Controls whether to create an alert when the Malware Scan Configuration logs an event. Set to true to enable the alert. Searchable as Boolean.

directoriesToScan.description: Specify if the scan will be peformed on all the directories or on a subset. Searchable as Choice.

directoryListID.description: ID of the directory list to scan. Set to 0 to remove any assignment. Searchable as Numeric.

filesToScan.description: Specify if scan will be performed on all files, a subset or by using IntelliScan. Searchable as Choice.

fileExtensionListID.description: ID of the file extension list to scan. Set to 0 to remove any assignment. Searchable as Numeric.

excludedDirectoryListID.description: ID of the directory list to exclude from the scan. Set to 0 to remove any assignment. Searchable as Numeric.

excludedFileListID.description: ID of the file list to exclude from the scan. Set to 0 to remove any assignment. Searchable as Numeric.

excludedFileExtensionListID.description: ID of the file extension list to exclude from the scan. Set to 0 to remove any assignment. Searchable as Numeric.

excludedProcessImageFileListID.description: ID of the process image file list to exclude from the scan. Set to 0 to remove any assignment. Searchable as Numeric.

realTimeScan.description: Specify when to perform the real-time scan. Searchable as Choice.

scanCompressedEnabled.description: Controls whether to scan compressed files. Use true to enable scan. Searchable as Boolean.

scanCompressedMaximumSize.description: Maximum size of compressed files to scan, in MB. Searchable as Numeric.

scanCompressedMaximumLevels.description: The maximum number of levels of compression to scan. Searchable as Numeric.

scanCompressedMaximumFiles.description: Maximum number of files to extract. Searchable as Numeric.

microsoftOfficeEnabled.description: Controls whether to scan Embedded Microsoft Office Objects. Use true to enable scan. Searchable as Boolean.

microsoftOfficeLayers.description: Number of Microsoft Object Linking and Embedding (OLE) Layers to scan. Searchable as Numeric.

networkDirectoriesEnabled.description: Controls whether to scan network directories. Set to true to enable. Searchable as Boolean.

customRemediationActionsEnabled.description: Controls whether to use the action ActiveActions recommends when malware is detected. Set to true to use the action ActiveAction recommends.

customScanActionsEnabled.description: Controls whether to use custom actions. Use true to enable custom actions. Available when 'customRemediationActionsEnabled' is true.

scanActionForVirus.description: The action to perform when a virus is detected. Searchable as Choice. Available when 'customScanActionsEnabled' is true.

scanActionForTrojans.description: The action to perform when a trojan is detected. Searchable as Choice. Available when 'customScanActionsEnabled' is true.

scanActionForPacker.description: The action to perform when a packer is detected. Searchable as Choice. Available when 'customScanActionsEnabled' is true.

scanActionForSpyware.description: The action to perform when spyware is detected. Searchable as Choice. Available when 'customScanActionsEnabled' is true.

scanActionForOtherThreats.description: The action to take when other threats are detected. Searchable as Choice. Available when 'customScanActionsEnabled' is true.

scanActionForCookies.description: The action to take when cookies are detected. Searchable as Choice. Available when 'customScanActionsEnabled' is true.

scanActionForCVE.description: The action to take when a CVE exploit is detected. Searchable as Choice. Available when 'customScanActionsEnabled' is true.

scanActionForHeuristics.description: The action to take when malware identified with heuristics are detected. Searchable as Choice. Available when 'customScanActionsEnabled' is true.

scanActionForPossibleMalware.description: The action to take when possible malware is detected. Searchable as Choice. Available when 'customRemediationActionsEnabled' is true.

amsiScanEnabled.description: Controls whether Windows Antimalware Scan Interface (AMSI) protection is enabled. Set to true to enable.

scanActionForBehaviorMonitoring.description: The action to take when suspicious activity and unauthorized changes are detected. Searchable as Choice. Available when 'behaviorMonitoringEnabled' is true.

scanActionForMachineLearning.description: The action to take when malware identified with machine learning is detected. Searchable as Choice. Available when 'machineLearningEnabled' is true.

scanActionForAmsi.description: The action to take when malware identified with AMSI protection is detected. Available when 'amsiScanEnabled' is true.

ID.description: ID of the anti-malware configuration. This ID is set automatically. Searchable as ID.

antiMalwareConfiguration.description: Configure protection against malware, viruses, trojans and spyware.

type.description: Specifies what type the ComputerGroup is. Defaults to `folder`

name.description: Name of the ComputerGroup. Searchable as String.

description.description: Description of the ComputerGroup. Searchable as String.

parentGroupID.description: ID of the ComputerGroup's parent group. Empty if the parent is a root ComputerGroup. ComputerGroup will be a root group unless a valid value for `parentGroupID` is set. Searchable as Numeric.

directoryID.description: ID of the ComputerGroup's directory server. Set to `0` if the group is not a directory server. Searchable as Numeric.

externalID.description: External ID of the ComputerGroup. Empty if the ComputerGroup is not created/managed by a cloud account. Searchable as String.

virtualID.description: ID of the ComputerGroup as it exists in VMware vCloud. Set to `0` if the ComputerGroup is not from vCloud. Searchable as Numeric.

virtualType.description: Type of the ComputerGroup as it exists in VMware vCloud. Set to `0` if the ComputerGroup is not from vCloud. Searchable as Numeric.

virtualName.description: Name of the ComputerGroup as it exists in VMware vCloud. Ignored if the ComputerGroup is not from vCloud. Searchable as String.

cloudType.description: Cloud platform of the ComputerGroup.  Ignored if the ComputerGroup does not represent a cloud container. Searchable as Choice.

cloudResourceType.description: Cloud container type of the ComputerGroup. This is platform dependent. Ignored if the ComputerGroup does not represent a cloud container. Searchable as Numeric.

cloudID.description: Cloud container ID of the ComputerGroup. Ignored if the ComputerGroup does not represent a cloud container. Searchable as Numeric.

amazonAccountID.description: Amazon Web Services account ID of the ComputerGroup. Set to `0` if the ComputerGroup does not represent an Amazon Web Services account. Searchable as Numeric.

amazonRegionID.description: Amazon Web Services region ID of the ComputerGroup. Set to `0` if the ComputerGroup does not represent an Amazon Web Services region. amazonWorkspacesID will be used instead if the ComputerGroup represents an Amazon Web Services WorkSpaces node. Searchable as Numeric.

amazonVPCID.description: Amazon Web Services Virtual Private Cloud ID of the ComputerGroup. Set to `0` if the ComputerGroup does not represent an Amazon Web Services Virtual Private Cloud. Searchable as Numeric.

amazonSubnetID.description: Amazon Web Services subnet ID of the ComputerGroup. Set to `0` if the ComputerGroup does not represent an Amazon Web Services subnet. Searchable as Numeric.

amazonWorkspacesID.description: Amazon Web Services WorkSpaces ID of the ComputerGroup. Set to `0` if the ComputerGroup does not represent an Amazon Web Services WorkSpace. Will be used instead of amazonRegionID if the ComputerGroup represents a WorkSpaces node under a region. Searchable as Numeric.

amazonDirectoryID.description: Amazon Web Services directory ID of the ComputerGroup. Set to `0` if the ComputerGroup does not represent an Amazon Web Services directory. Searchable as Numeric.

ID.description: ID of the ComputerGroup. Searchable as ID.

computerGroup.description: Logical containers to organize computers that are protected by Deep Security Manager.

assignedRuleIDs.description: IDs of IntegrityMonitoringRules assigned to the computer or policy.

recommendationScanStatus.description: Status of the last recommendation scan done on a computer or policy.

lastRecommendationScanDate.description: Timestamp of the last recommendation scan date, in milliseconds since epoch.

recommendedToAssignRuleIDs.description: IntegrityMonitoringRules separated by commas, that were recommended to be assigned to the computer or policy by a recommendation scan.

recommendedToUnassignRuleIDs.description: IntegrityMonitoringRules, separated by commas, that were recommended to be unassigned from the computer or policy by a recommendation scan.

name.description: Name of the IntegrityMonitoringRule. Searchable as String.

description.description: Description of the IntegrityMonitoringRule. Searchable as String.

minimumAgentVersion.description: Minimum Deep Security Agent version that supports the IntegrityMonitoringRule. This value is provided in the X.X.X.X format. Defaults to `6.0.0.0`. If an agent is not the minimum required version, the manager does not send the rule to the agent, and generates an alert. Searchable as String.

minimumManagerVersion.description: Minimum Deep Security Manager version that supports the IntegrityMonitoringRule. This value is provided in the X.X.X format. Defaults to `6.0.0`. An alert will be raised if a manager that fails to meet the minimum manager version value tries to assign this rule to a host or profile. Searchable as String.

severity.description: Severity level of the event is multiplied by the computer's asset value to determine ranking. Ranking can be used to sort events with more business impact. Searchable as Choice.

type.description: Type of the IntegrityMonitoringRule. If the rule is predefined by Trend Micro, it is set to `2`. If it is user created, it is set to `1`. Searchable as String.

originalIssue.description: Timestamp when the IntegrityMonitoringRule was originally issued by Trend Micro, in milliseconds since epoch.  Empty if the IntegrityMonitoringRule is user created. Searchable as Date.

lastUpdated.description: Timestamp when the IntegrityMonitoringRule was last updated, in milliseconds since epoch. Searchable as Date.

identifier.description: Identifier of the IntegrityMonitoringRule from Trend Micro. Empty if the IntegrityMonitoringRule is user created. Searchable as String.

registryKeyRoot.description: Registry hive which is monitored by the IntegrityMonitoringRule. Empty if the IntegrityMonitoringRule does not monitor a registry key.

registryKeyValue.description: Registry key which is monitored by the IntegrityMonitoringRule. Empty if the IntegrityMonitoringRule does not monitor a registry key. Ignored if the IntegrityMonitoringRule does not monitor a registry key.

registryIncludeSubKeys.description: Controls whether the IntegrityMonitoringRule should also include subkeys of the registry key it monitors. Defaults to `false`. Ignored if the IntegrityMonitoringRule does not monitor a registry key.

registryIncludedValues.description: Registry key values to be monitored by the IntegrityMonitoringRule. JSON array or delimited by `\n`. `?` matches a single character, while `*` matches zero or more characters. Ignored if the IntegrityMonitoringRule does not monitor a registry key.

registryIncludeDefaultValue.description: Controls whether the rule should monitor default registry key values. Defaults to `true`. Ignored if the IntegrityMonitoringRule does not monitor a registry key.

registryExcludedValues.description: Registry key values to be ignored by the IntegrityMonitoringRule. JSON array or delimited by `\n`. `?` matches a single character, while `*` matches zero or more characters. Ignored if the IntegrityMonitoringRule does not monitor a registry key.

registryAttributes.description: Registry key attributes to be monitored by the IntegrityMonitoringRule. JSON array or delimited by `\n`. Defaults to `STANDARD` which will monitor changes in registry size, content and type. Ignored if the IntegrityMonitoringRule does not monitor a registry key.

fileBaseDirectory.description: Base of the file directory to be monitored by the IntegrityMonitoringRule. Ignored if the IntegrityMonitoringRule does not monitor a file directory.

fileIncludeSubDirectories.description: Controls whether the IntegrityMonitoringRule should also monitor sub-directories of the base file directory that is associated with it. Defaults to `false`. Ignored if the IntegrityMonitoringRule does not monitor a file directory.

fileIncludedValues.description: File name values to be monitored by the IntegrityMonitoringRule. JSON array or delimited by `\n`. `?` matches a single character, while `*` matches zero or more characters. Leaving this field blank when monitoring file directories will cause the IntegrityMonitoringRule to monitor all files in a directory. This can use significant system resources if the base directory contains numerous or large files. Ignored if the IntegrityMonitoringRule does not monitor a file directory.

fileExcludedValues.description: File name values to be ignored by the IntegrityMonitoringRule. JSON array or delimited by `\n`. `?` matches a single character, while `*` matches zero or more characters. Ignored if the IntegrityMonitoringRule does not monitor a file directory.

fileAttributes.description: File attributes to be monitored by the IntegrityMonitoringRule. JSON array or delimited by `\n`. Defaults to `STANDARD` which will monitor changes in file creation date, last modified date, permissions, owner, group, size, content, flags (Windows) and SymLinkPath (Linux). Ignored if the IntegrityMonitoringRule does not monitor a file directory.

customXML.description: Custom XML rules to be used by the IntegrityMonitoringRule. Custom XML rules must be encoded in the Base64 format. Ignored if the IntegrityMonitoringRule does not follow the `custom` template.

alertEnabled.description: Controls whether an alert should be made if an event related to the IntegrityMonitoringRule is logged. Defaults to `false`. Searchable as Boolean.

realTimeMonitoringEnabled.description: Controls whether the IntegrityMonitoringRule is monitored in real time or during every scan. Defaults to `true` which indicates that it is monitored in real time. A value of `false` indicates that it will only be checked during scans. Searchable as Boolean.

recommendationsMode.description: Indicates whether recommendation scans consider the IntegrityMonitoringRule. Can be set to enabled or ignored. Custom rules cannot be recommended. Searchable as Choice.

ID.description: ID of the IntegrityMonitoringRule. Searchable as ID.

integrityMonitoringRule.description: Integrity monitoring rules describe how Deep Security Agents should scan for and detect changes to a computer's files, directories and registry keys and values as well as changes in installed software, processes, listening ports and running services. Integrity monitoring rules can be assigned directly to computers or can be made part of a policy.

assignedRuleIDs.description: IDs of the intrusion prevention rules currently assigned.

assignedApplicationTypeIDs.description: IDs of the application types currently assigned.

recommendationScanStatus.description: Status of the last recommendation scan.

lastRecommendationScanDate.description: Timestamp of the last recommendation scan, in milliseconds since epoch.

recommendedToAssignRuleIDs.description: IDs of the intrusion prevention rules recommended for assignment.

recommendedToUnassignRuleIDs.description: IDs of the intrusion prevention rules recommended for unassignment.

name.description: Name of the IntrusionPreventionRule. Searchable as String.

description.description: Description of the IntrusionPreventionRule. Searchable as String.

minimumAgentVersion.description: Version of the Deep Security agent or appliance required to support the rule. Searchable as String.

applicationTypeID.description: ID of the application type for the IntrusionPreventionRule. Searchable as Numeric.

priority.description: Priority level of the rule. Higher priority rules are applied before lower priority rules. Searchable as Choice.

severity.description: Severity level of the rule. Severity levels can be used as sorting criteria and affect event rankings. Searchable as Choice.

detectOnly.description: In detect mode, the rule creates an event log and does not interfere with traffic.

eventLoggingDisabled.description: Enable to prevent event logs from being created when the rule is triggered. Not available if detectOnly is true. Searchable as Boolean.

generateEventOnPacketDrop.description: Generate an event every time a packet is dropped for the rule. Not available if eventLoggingDisabled is true. Searchable as Boolean.

alwaysIncludePacketData.description: Enabled to include package data in the event logs. Not available if eventLoggingDisabled is true. Searchable as Boolean.

debugModeEnabled.description: Enable to log additional packets preceeding and following the packet that the rule detected. Not available if eventLoggingDisabled is true. Searchable as Boolean.

type.description: Type of IntrusionPreventionRule. Searchable as Choice.

originalIssue.description: Timestamp of the date the rule was released, in milliseconds since epoch. Searchable as Date.

lastUpdated.description: Timestamp of the last rule modification, in milliseconds since epoch. Searchable as Date.

identifier.description: Unique identification tag of the rule. Searchable as String.

template.description: Type of template for the IntrusionPreventionRule. Applicable only to custom rules.

signature.description: Signature of the rule. Applicable to custom rules with template type signature.

start.description: Start pattern of the rule. Applicable to custom rules with template type start-end-patterns.

patterns.description: Body patterns of the rule, which must be found between start and end patterns. Applicable to custom rules with template type start-end-patterns.

end.description: End pattern of the rule. Applicable to custom rules with template type start-end-patterns.

caseSensitive.description: Enable to make signatures and patterns case sensitive. Applicable to custom rules with template type signature or start-end-patterns.

condition.description: Condition to determine if the rule is triggered. Applicable to custom rules with template type start-end-patterns.

action.description: Action to apply if the rule is triggered. Applicable to custom rules with template type signature or start-end-patterns.

customXML.description: The custom XML used to define the rule. Applicable to custom rules with template type custom.

alertEnabled.description: Enable to raise an alert when the rule logs an event. Searchable as Boolean.

scheduleID.description: ID of the schedule which defines times during which the rule is active. Set to 0 to remove any assignment. Searchable as Numeric.

contextID.description: ID of the context in which the rule is applied. Set to 0 to remove any assignment. Searchable as Numeric.

recommendationsMode.description: Indicates whether recommendation scans consider the IntrusionPreventionRule. Can be set to enabled or ignored. Custom rules cannot be recommended. Searchable as Choice.

canBeAssignedAlone.description: True when the rule has no dependencies.

dependsOnRuleIDs.description: IDs of intrusion prevention rules the rule depends on, which will be automatically assigned if this rule is assigned.

ID.description: ID of the IntrusionPreventionRule. Searchable as ID.

CVSSScore.description: A measure of the severity of the vulnerability according the National Vulnerability Database. Searchable as String or as Numeric.

CVE.description: List of CVEs associated with the IntrusionPreventionRule. Searchable as String.

intrusionPreventionRule.description: Intrusion Prevention rule details. Intrusion prevention rules define a set of conditions that are compared to the payload session and application layers of network packets (such as DNS, HTTP, SSL, and SMTP), as well as the sequence of those packets according to those higher-layer protocols.

assignedRuleIDs.description: IDs of the log inspection rules currently assigned.

recommendationScanStatus.description: Status of the last recommendation scan.

lastRecommendationScanDate.description: Timestamp of the last recommendation scan, in milliseconds since epoch.

recommendedToAssignRuleIDs.description: IDs of the log inspection rules recommended for assignment.

recommendedToUnassignRuleIDs.description: IDs of the log inspection rules recommended for unassignment.

logInspectionAssignments.description: Result of a log inspection recommendation.

location.description: File path of the log file.

format.description: Structure of the data in the log file. The application that generates the log file defines the structure of the data.

logFile.description: Describes the file path and format of the log file.

name.description: Name of the LogInspectionRule. Searchable as String.

description.description: Description of the LogInspectionRule that appears in search results, and on the General tab in the Deep Security Manager user interface. Searchable as String.

minimumAgentVersion.description: Minimum Deep Security Agent version required by the LogInspectionRule. Searchable as String.

minimumManagerVersion.description: Minimumn Deep Security Manager version required by the LogInspectionRule. Searchable as String.

type.description: Type of the LogInspectionRule. The value 'Defined' is used for LogInspectionRules provided by Trend Micro. Searchable as String.

originalIssue.description: Creation timestamp of the LogInspectionRule, measured in milliseconds since epoch. Searchable as Date.

lastUpdated.description: Update timestamp of the LogInspectionRule, measured in milliseconds since epoch. Searchable as Date.

identifier.description: Indentifier of the LogInspectionRule used in the Deep Security Manager user interface. Searchable as String.

template.description: Template used to create this rule.

ruleID.description: ID of the LogInspectionRule sent to the Deep Security Agent. The values 100000 - 109999 are reserved for user-definded rules.

level.description: Log level of the LogInspectionRule indicates severity of attack. Level 0 is the least severe and will not log an event. Level 15 is the most severe.

groups.description: Groups that the LogInspectionRule is assigned to, separated by commas. Useful when dependency is used as it's possible to create a LogInspectionRule that fires when another LogInspectionRule belonging to a specific group fires.

ruleDescription.description: Description of the LogInspectionRule that appears on events and the Content tab in the Deep Security Manager user interface. Alternatively, you can configure this by inserting a description in 'ruleXML'.

pattern.description: Regular expression pattern the LogInspectionRule will look for in the logs. The rule will be triggered on a match. Open Source HIDS SEcurity (OSSEC) regular expression syntax is supported, see http://www.ossec.net/docs/syntax/regex.html.

patternType.description: Pattern the LogInspectionRule will look for in the logs. The string matching pattern is faster than the regex pattern.

dependency.description: Indicates if a dependant rule or dependency group is set or not. If set, the LogInspectionRule will only log an event if the dependency is triggered. Available for user-defined rules.

dependencyRuleID.description: If dependency is configured, the ID of the rule that this rule is dependant on. Ignored if the rule is from Trend Micro, which uses `dependsOnRuleIDs` instead.

dependencyGroup.description: If dependency is configured, the dependancy groups that this rule is dependant on.

frequency.description: Number of times the dependant rule has to match within a specific time frame before the rule is triggered.

timeFrame.description: Time period for the frequency of LogInspectionRule triggers that will generate an event, in seconds.

ruleXML.description: LogInspectionRule in an XML format. For information on the XML format, see http://ossec-docs.readthedocs.io/en/latest/syntax/head_rules.html

alertEnabled.description: Controls whether to raise an alert when a LogInspectionRule logs an event. Use true to raise an alert. Searchable as Boolean.

alertMinimumSeverity.description: Severity level that will trigger an alert. Ignored unless `ruleXML` contains multiple rules with different severities, and so you must indicate which severity level to use. Searchable as Numeric.

recommendationsMode.description: Indicates whether recommendation scans consider the LogInspectionRule. Can be set to enabled or ignored. Custom rules cannot be recommended. Searchable as Choice.

sortOrder.description: Order in which LogInspectionRules are sent to the Deep Security Agent. Log inspeciton rules are sent in ascending order. Valid values are between 10000 and 20000.

canBeAssignedAlone.description: Indicates whether this LogInspectionRule can be allocated without allocating any additional LogInspectionRules. Ignored if the rule is user-defined, which uses `dependency` instead.

dependsOnRuleIDs.description: IDs of LogInspectionRules, separated by commas, that are required by this rule. Ignored if the rule is user-defined, which uses `dependencyRuleID` or `dependencyGroup` instead.

ID.description: ID of the LogInspectionRule. This number is set automatically. Searchable as ID.

logInspectionRule.description: Contains string matching and threshold to trigger alerts as well as group information for LogInspectionRules.

The value of the rule.
The value for general-agent-activated/general-agent-offline/general-crio-host/general-docker-host would be yes/no.
The value for general-computer-type would be physical-computer/amazon-ec2-instance/aws-workspace/vcloud-virtual-machine/azure-instance/azure-arm-instance/gcp-compute-instance.
The value for general-policy would be policy ID.

smartFolderRuleGroup.description: Details of rule group in smart folder.

cloudPlatform.description: The cloud platform(aws/azure/gcp) of the tag folder.

cloudTagOrLabelKey.description: Tag folders name key of cloud platform.

tagFolder.description: Details of a tag folder for AWS/GCP/Azure.

computerID.description: ID of the computer on which the software change was found. Searchable as Numeric.

computerGroupID.description: ID of the computer group where the software change was found. Searchable as Numeric.

vendorName.description: Vendor name associated with the changed software. Searchable as String.

productName.description: Product name associated with the changed software. Searchable as String.

productVersion.description: Product version associated with the changed software. Searchable as String.

fileVersion.description: File version associated with the changed software. Searchable as String.

fileDescription.description: File description associated with the changed software. Searchable as String.

sha1.description: SHA1 hash calculated from the changed software. Searchable as String.

sha256.description: SHA256 hash calculated from the changed software. Searchable as String.

md5.description: MD5 hash calculated from the changed software. Searchable as String.

fileName.description: File name of the changed software. Searchable as String.

installPath.description: Path on which the software change was found. Searchable as String.

fileSize.description: File size of the changed software in bytes. Searchable as Numeric.

changeEventTime.description: Time the software change was discovered, in milliseconds since epoch. Searchable as Date.

changeByUser.description: Username of the user that introduced the software change. Searchable as String.

changeByUserID.description: User ID of the user that introduced the software change. Searchable as String.

changeByProcess.description: Name of the process that introduced the software change. Searchable as String.

changeByProcessID.description: Process ID of the process that introduced the software change. Searchable as String.

ID.description: ID of software change. Searchable as Numeric.

action.description: Action to perform on the software changes.

ruleIDs.description: List of the rule IDs for newly created rules.

computerID.description: ID of the computer that the inventory scan was performed on (or is being performed on). Searchable as Numeric.

name.description: Name of the inventory. Searchable as String.

description.description: Description of the inventory. Searchable as String.

state.description: State of the inventory scan. Searchable as Choice.

startDate.description: Time the inventory scan was started, in milliseconds since epoch. Searchable as Date.

completedDate.description: Time the inventory scan was completed, in milliseconds since epoch. Searchable as Date.

initiatorID.description: Either the ID of the administrator that initiated the inventory scan or the ID of the API key if the inventory scan was initiated using an API Key. Searchable as Numeric.

ID.description: ID of the software inventory. Searchable as ID.

vendorName.description: Vendor name of the inventory item as reported by the package management system on the computer. Searchable as String.

productName.description: Product name of the inventory item as reported by the package management system on the computer. Searchable as String.

productVersion.description: Product version of the inventory item as reported by the package management system on the computer. Searchable as String.

fileVersion.description: File version of the inventory item as reported by the package management system on the computer. Searchable as String.

fileDescription.description: File description of the inventory item as reported by the package management system on the computer. Searchable as String.

category.description: File category of the inventory item as reported by the package management system on the computer. Searchable as String.

sha256.description: SHA-256 hash of the inventory item. Searchable as String.

sha1.description: SHA-1 hash of the inventory item. Searchable as String.

md5.description: MD5 hash of the inventory item. Searchable as String.

fileName.description: File name of the inventory item. Searchable as String.

path.description: File path of the inventory item. Searchable as String.

size.description: File size of the inventory item in bytes. Searchable as Numeric.

ID.description: ID of the inventory item. Searchable as ID.

name.description: Name of the stateful configuration. Searchable as String.

description.description: Description of the stateful configuration. Searchable as String.

denyFragmentedPacketsEnabled.description: Controls if fragmented packets are denied. Set to true to deny fragmented packets. Searchable as Boolean.

denyPacketsContainingCwrOrEceEnabled.description: Controls if TCP CWR, ECE flags are denied. Set to true to enable CWR or ECE flags. Searchable as Boolean.

maxIncomingConnections.description: Maximum allowed incoming connections. Searchable as Numeric.

maxOutgoingConnections.description: Maximum allowed outgoing connections. Searchable as Numeric.

maxHalfOpenConnections.description: Maximum allowed half open connections. Searchable as Numeric.

ID.description: ID of the stateful configuration. Searchable as ID.

name.description: Name of the syslog configuration. The maximum length is 254 characters. Searchable as String.

description.description: Description of the syslog configuration. The maximum length is 2000 characters. Searchable as String.

hostName.description: Server name of the syslog configuration. The maximum length is 253 characters. Searchable as String.

port.description: Port of the syslog configuration. Default is "514".

agentDirectForwarding.description: Flag indicating whether access to the syslog configuration is directly to the syslog server (true) or is it via the manager (false). Default is "false".

includeTimezone.description: Flag indicating whether time zone is included in events. Default is "false".

privateKey.description: Private key of the syslog configuration, write only. It's a PEM formatted string.

certificateChain.description: Certificate chain of the syslog configuration. It's a PEM formatted string.

transport.description: Transport of the syslog configuration. Default is "udp".

eventFormat.description: Event format of the syslog configuration. Default is "cef".

facility.description: Facility of the syslog configuration. Default is "local0".

sourceIdentifier.description: Log source identifier of the syslog configuration. The maximum length is 254 characters.

lastStatus.description: Last connect/send status of the syslog configuration.

lastStatusDate.description: Last connect/send status time of the syslog configuration.

ID.description: ID of the syslog configuration. Searchable as ID.

tenantUpdateState.description: Tenant Update State. Valid values are 'pending-deletion' and 'active'

customerAccountID.description: customer Account ID of the tenant.

name.description: The name of the attribute.

TrustRuleAttribute.description: Attribute that defines the trust rule.

type.description: Type of the rule. Searchable as Choice.

name.description: Name of the trust rule. Searchable as String.

description.description: Description of the trust rule. Searchable as String.

isAssigned.description: Whether the rule is assigned to any rulesets

createdTime.description: Timestamp of the trust rule's creation, in milliseconds since epoch. Searchable as Date.

lastUpdatedTime.description: Timestamp of when the trust rule was last updated, in milliseconds since epoch. Searchable as Date.

rulesetIDs.description: IDs of all rulesets that the rule is assigned to.

attributes.description: Attributes that define the trust rule.

ID.description: ID of the trust rule. Searchable as ID.

name.description: Name of the trust rule. Searchable as String.

description.description: Description of the trust rule. Searchable as String.

name.description: Name of the trust ruleset. Searchable as String.

description.description: Description of the trust ruleset. Searchable as String.

version.description: Version number of the trust ruleset. Incremented by one whenever the ruleset rules are modified. Searchable as Numeric.

createdTime.description: Timestamp of the trust ruleset's creation, in milliseconds since epoch. Searchable as Date.

lastUpdatedTime.description: Timestamp of when the trust ruleset was last updated, in milliseconds since epoch. Searchable as Date.

ID.description: ID of the trust ruleset. Searchable as ID.

name.description: Name of the trust ruleset. Searchable as String.

description.description: Description of the trust ruleset. Searchable as String.

TrustRuleIDs.description: ID numbers of trust rules in a trust ruleset.

Name of the policy

type.description: Type of the VCenterConnectorAction.

ID.description: ID of the VCenterConnectorAction.

vCenterConnectorAction.description: The supported action of a vCenter connector.

id.description: ID number of the vCenter connector.

name.description: Display name of the connector.

description.description: Description of the connector.

username.description: Username that the connector will use to authenticate to vCenter.

password.description: Password of the vCenter user. Must be base64-encoded.

Expand.description: The expand parameter for a Computer.
